channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Megan Levy
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: More than 900,000 COVID-19 tests carried out in Australia as cases surpass 4.3 million worldwide, nation's death toll stands at 98

item.dc:creator: Broede Carmody
item.description: Outgoing radio broadcaster Alan Jones will be paid out his full 2GB salary despite missing key incentive targets.
item.title: Alan Jones to receive full 2GB payout as Sky News speculation swirls

item.description: Follow our rolling coverage.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Coronavirus outbreak

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: In an online community forum attended by the Herald, Infrastructure NSW and developer John Holland outlined the updated timeline that won't see full completion until the end of September.
item.title: Sydney Football Stadium completion date raises fears for 2022 NRL grand final

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: The 20-year-old uni student spent 11 days in isolation in March, and is urging others like him to join a QIMR study to help people who get very sick from the virus.
item.title: One of Queensland's first COVID-19 patients joins clinical study

item.dc:creator: Nick Bonyhady
item.description: One of the country's top employer bodies is also calling for JobKeeper to be expanded to more businesses and rejected calls for it to be wound back early.
item.title: HECS-style loans for businesses could help transition from JobKeeper

item.dc:creator: Lisa Visentin
item.description: NSW Planning Minister Rob Stokes advised the Independent Planning Commission of the new benchmarks in a written "statement of expectations" obtained by the Herald.
item.title: All controversial projects determined in 12 weeks, Minister demands

item.dc:creator: Clay Lucas
item.description: Up to 5000 new jobs would be created by construction of scores of new recycling centres across Victoria, the state’s infrastructure advisor says.
item.title: Thousands of jobs could come from scores of new recycling centres

item.dc:creator: Lisa Visentin
item.description: Social welfare organisations will use new research to lobby the Berejiklian government to invest in social housing to help drive NSW's post-pandemic economic recovery.
item.title: Welfare agencies lobby for construction stimulus plan

item.dc:creator: Linda Morris
item.description: A report prepared for Infrastructure NSW said the relocation of the Powerhouse to Parramatta would entail the demolition of historic buildings that were "one of a kind".
item.title: New Powerhouse Museum report approves loss of heritage buildings

item.dc:creator: Jordan Baker
item.description: Students will receive mid-year school reports, but the federal government will drop its requirement for schools to give them a grading between A and E for every subject.
item.title: Mid-year school reports to go ahead, without controversial A-E grading

item.dc:creator: Tom Rabe
item.description: Some of Sydney’s best known venues are facing a new problem: will they even be able to turn a profit?
item.title: 'We don't want to go further into debt': restaurants prepare to reopen

item.dc:creator: Nick O'Malley
item.description: The world's largest sovereign wealth fund has dumped one Australian company and warned another over their records on climate change.
item.title: AGL and BHP sanctioned by Norwegian wealth fund over emissions

item.dc:creator: Jessica Irvine
item.description: Our path back to prosperity will require a return to the free trade that has enriched us in the past, but that doesn't mean we can't make it fairer and better.
item.title: Now is no time to turn our backs on globalisation

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: The state's corruption watchdog's funding stoush with the Berejiklian government has escalated.
item.title: ICAC funding 'unlawful' and puts independence at risk: legal advice

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Thursday, May 14

item.dc:creator: Fergus Hunter
item.description: The Paul Ramsay Foundation has also confirmed a long-term grant for the controversial Ramsay Centre for Western Civilisation.
item.title: Australia's largest philanthropic fund announces plan to tackle poverty

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: Border Force officers would be able to search immigration detainees, and those suspected of carrying out illegal activity could have mobile phones banned.
item.title: Government making second attempt to give Border Force police-like powers

item.dc:creator: Pru Goward
item.description: Peter V’landys, at the helm of both racing and rugby league, does not have to be liked and does not appear to care. And that may be his great strength.
item.title: A model for fearless leadership in a crisis? Hint: he steers two major sports

item.description: Blunt attacks on the world stage may not be the best course when dealing with China.
item.title: Farmers left to deal with a bull in a china shop fallout

item.description: After 10 years in full-time work, I find almost everything about corporate life silly.
item.title: The jargon, the pettiness: am I unsuited to modern work life?

item.dc:creator: Sophie Aubrey
item.description: Health experts are warning that if older Australians don't work their muscles during the pandemic, their strength is at risk of wasting away.
item.title: The exercise older Australians need to incorporate into their day

item.description: COVID-19 has forever changed the way doctors will work. An advocate for digital health writes that the transformation needs scrutiny.
item.title: Telemedicine has its hurdles: a doctor for troubled kids reports from the COVID sidelines

item.dc:creator: Lissa Christopher
item.description: Life got you feeling down? These books, apps, shows and sites might help you out, even if it's just by way of a much-needed laugh.
item.title: Five resources to boost your mood and promote mental wellbeing

item.description: Sir William Dobell was widely regarded as Australia's finest painter. When he died, the Herald joined locals at the Wangi pub to remember a much-loved drinking companion.
item.title: From the Archives, 1970: Wangi mourns its favourite 'Bill'

item.description: A US-based Australian school principal hasn't seen her husband since he travelled to Sydney 10 weeks ago to see their adult children. Stuck at home in lockdown, he made a gallant attempt to 'home school' them.
item.title: A world apart, my family's quest for domestic bliss (ish)

item.dc:creator: Harry Hollinsworth
item.description: Mushbrella, Royal rounds and plainclothes patrols.
item.title: In the Herald : May 14, 1968

item.dc:creator: Matt O'Sullivan
item.description: Parts of the city's upper north shore and the outer west were among the areas worst affected.
item.title: Illegally dumped waste surges in Sydney due to 'COVID cleanout'

item.dc:creator: Josh Dye
item.description: From My Window is the first new exhibition centred around the lockdown from a major art gallery.
item.title: Art Gallery of NSW commissions new lockdown-themed exhibition

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, May 14, 2020

item.dc:creator: Kylar Loussikian
item.description: Scott Morrison is not the only one on Capital Hill to have celebrated a birthday this week. Former Labor leader Bill Shorten also had a little gathering.
item.title: Socially distant celebrations at Canberra birthday bashes

item.dc:creator: Benjamin Preiss
item.description: A coalition of leading housing groups is warning of a new wave of homelessness unless there is a major boost in social housing construction.
item.title: Call for 60,000 social housing units to stave off post-lockdown crisis

item.dc:creator: Eryk Bagshaw
item.description: China's economic retaliation for Australia's pursuit of a global coronavirus inquiry has triggered national division and a rebuke from business leaders.
item.title: 'Dangerous, damaging': China trade dispute triggers national division

item.dc:creator: Chip Le Grand
item.description: The economist who helped salvage Victoria from the 1990s recession is pushing for a public sector audit, as he notes the damage being inflicted on the private sector.
item.title: Victoria warned 'severe remedies' needed to revive state finances

item.dc:creator: Sarah Danckert
item.description: Andrew Demetriou has long denied allegations he was a 'shadow director' at collapsed education group Acquire.
item.title: Liquidators chase former AFL boss Andrew Demetriou over payments

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted in the work of our award-winning cartoonists.
item.title: Today's cartoons: The illustrated news

item.description: The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: Gallery: The best photos from around the world

item.dc:creator: Dana McCauley
item.description: Macquarie University Hospital has launched a hunt for a whistleblower who called attention to orthopaedic surgery performed during the elective surgery ban.
item.title: Hospital launches investigation into elective surgery whistleblower

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: Major banks say house prices could collapse by up to 30 per cent in the next three years in a prolonged economic slump as CBD rentals are drained of tenants.
item.title: Banks warn house prices could fall up to 30 per cent as rental vacancies surge

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: As the day unfolded: Fears over COVID-19-linked Kawasaki disease sparks calls for urgent research, global cases surpass 4.2 million as Australian death toll stands at 98

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: AFL is battling to win over South Australian health officials after their application for a quarantine exemption was rebuffed again.
item.title: South Australia health concerns a major hiccup for AFL restart plans

item.dc:creator: Rachael Dexter
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: As it happened: First day of eased restrictions in Victoria, WorkSafe launches Cedar Meats investigation

item.dc:creator: Marta Pascual Juanola
item.description: The personal details of subscribers to WA's major daily newspaper may have been compromised after the Seven West Media masthead was targeted by hackers.
item.title: Hackers target WA's major daily newspaper, putting data of subscribers at risk

item.description: Better than Cheetos for Mother's Day.
item.title: The bright side of Mundey mourning

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: AFL players and officials who breach the strict quarantine protocols being put in place to enable clubs to return to training and playing could face charges of "conduct unbecoming".
item.title: AFL to invoke 'conduct unbecoming' charge for protocol breach

item.dc:creator: Andrew Wu
item.description: An extraordinary stand-off between Cricket Australia and two member states could be headed for arbitration.
item.title: Deadlock: States holding firm against Cricket Australia over cuts

item.dc:creator: Michael Chammas
item.description: ARLC chairman Peter V'landys says scrapping the two-referee system, which will save the NRL about $2.5 million this year, will produce more "free-flowing rugby league”.
item.title: ARLC approves one referee and six-again rule in radical change

item.dc:creator: Adam Carey
item.description: The university faces a revenue downturn of between $285 million and $350 million this year and next year due to the loss of international students during the COVID-19 pandemic.
item.title: La Trobe Uni staff urged to take pay cuts to save up to 800 jobs

item.dc:creator: Sam McClure
item.description: AFL teams may be asked to play home games against West Coast and Fremantle in Queensland in order to restart the season.
item.title: Marooned: Victorian teams may play home games against WA clubs in Queensland

item.dc:creator: Andrew Webster
item.description: The ARL Commission dropped the ball in deferring to the chairman and allowing the game to revert to one referee again in order to save some money.
item.title: V'landys gets his way with one-ref rule - so what's next?
